title: ADC's Just have too much defensive itemization...
body: They have in-combat sustain, access to armor and MR items... You can't really just blow them up easily (if they are miss-positioned) anymore...

its a flat 30% reduction, then that 30 percent that got mitigated is then dealt over three seconds

i agree that there is not a big difference if the damage dealt would not have been fatal

but let me give an example that is all to familar to me

i land a max range spear (that damage is reduced by 30%)
i pounce in (reduced by 30%, i swipe (again reduced by 30%)

now at this point they have taken an effective 30% damage reduction...  they might have taken about 5% of that damage back over the half second i closed the distance with pounce)

but when i land i use takedown...

now... this skills SCALES off their missing hp..

well at the moment i use takedown.. they have MORE hp than they would have without 30% reduction...

so my takedown isn't JUST reduced by the 30%.. its also reduced by them NOT have taking at LEAST 20% of that damage that would have been dealt to them leaving with with a MINIMUM of 20% MORE (even assuming it takes me an entire second to land the takedown) hp than would have...

i cant WAIT becuase then they would turn around and kill me... i can't even  {{item:3157}}  becuase they would still turn around and either heal off minions or they would flat out run away... and since i already used my gap closer... i cant do much...

and i CANT wait three seconds after landing the spear.. becuase hunted only LASTS 4 seconds.. and it would take absolutely perfect timing with no minions nearby and the enemy having no play to escape to and not getting out of my pounce range to just that last second AND take the takedown in time for it STILL to be empowered with them hunted. (becuase if they aren't hunted then it does MUCH less)

I used to be against all adc defensive itemization but the more i think about it the more i realize that the main problem is not adc defensive itemization it is ADC itemization that lets them build into unstoppable 1v1 duelist champions that can out perform the best duelists in the game such as {{champion:24}} {{champion:114}}, in short i believe that items that grant duelist stats should not exist and such things should only be on a champions abilities/passives.

Such items existing downgrade the effectiveness of picking a jax or fiora vs a draven, lucian, vayne which is silly because why should they be able to transform themselves into duelists with 1 or 2 items?

In short {{item:3046}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3072}} need to be changed/removed to prevent this from happening.

Riot delayed Assassin damage and then made it so adc's take delayed damage. That's quite a lot of guaranteed delayed damage for a class of champions designed to damage champions over time if you ask me

Not to mention all the increased shields and lifesteal thrown in as well.

Not only did Riot double down on the subtle adc buffs, but they tripled and even quadrupled the different defensive capabilities this class of champions can easily obtain. 

Adc's have the strongest defensive arsenal I've seen in my time playing league, which isn't a supppper long time, but still.

I'm only downvoting you because you didn't speak the truth:

ADC's take 12% reduced total damage, and that total damage is delayed by 30% over 3 seconds. How can you think that's an ok thing when ADC's have spent 6 seasons being balanced around the ability to be bursted. ADC's as a class are built around sustained fights, and when you give them properties to *guarantee* a sustained fight then you lose the opportunity to target the class' core weakness: burst.

Not only that, but those champions who were dedicated to bursting adcs have all been forced to have delayed damage as well.

Even on top of that you completely failed to acknowledge the incredible amount of shields and healing that is now prevalent in the game for adcs, especially with the ultra-buffed support items.

Over all of this they still have the advantage of range as well as their usual lifesteal.

How can you not say that adc's have access to more defensive properties than ever before. I never said all of the defensive properties came from solely the adcs, I'm saying there is more defensive shit in the game *for* adcs (not just *from them) than ever before.

You simply don't speak the truth, you speak part of the truth that ensures a different conclusion can be drawn from you incomplete summary of the game's balance around adcs

The shields and heals are coming from the support are going to the team, not just the adc. Does it look like the adc seems more overbearing? Yes they look overbearing because of the support items, and the masteries. However everything wants to kill them, and supports felt underwhelming before. Now they are feel like they are making a difference in team fights. However no one looks at them. They only look at where the heals and shields are going to, the ADC, or the team mates. However fuck them, gotta look at the adc! The one doing all the dps late game. 

GA, maw were not given to the ADC to use. They were for all AD related champs to use. Assassins, brusiers, fighters, and adc to use. The only reason people bitch about GA and Maw being this so called ADC use it item is because someone bought it on them that they disliked. Items countering me!? Die Heathen!

I simply dont speak the truth? You're right, what am I a lowly adc main that doesn't speak the truth. The games balance around the ADC?  It is, but quite. It's the position of bot lane that holds the key to the game. Why? Because the turret doesn't have a shield, they have a dragon spawning, and they have two champions down there compared to the other lanes with one champion. People going to bot lane with a teleport for a 5 main or 4 main. Is the game balanced around ADC? It is, only because everyone keeps putting so much emphasis on bot lane. Why do you think they have rift herald? To give bot lane less pressure and top lane something. Instead it's still this big ole fucking island anyways. 
Edit: Forgot to mention those shields dont come offline till 5 minutes on turrets. 

The advantage of range is in every game, and any mage that is ranged as well. 

The usual lifesteal is made to where it is because of warlords which procs once till it recharges, and crit that makes lifesteal look so good.

Edit: You can still burst them.

this entire comment was excuses for why adc's have these defensive options yet my comment was about how they do...you've provided nothing to this discussion but excuses.

- It doesn't matter if the whole team recieves the shield. A 700hp shield is more valuable and important on the ADC than it is on the Rammus, and that 700hp shield is *still* defensive stats for the adc. You're whole "well the whole team gets it, not just the adc" argument means literally nothing to the discussion.

- As for support items in general. Cool? Supports became incredibly influential without ADC's receiving any compensation nerf, sounds fair to me :^)
(and once again, you just stated a reason for why these defensive properties are available despite that not being the discussion)

- Your argument about GA and Maw isn't even relevant either. No one cares what the items are meant for, the fact is that they provide incredible defensive stats for adcs. Saying that people only complain about those items because an adc used it is *literally the point*. ADC's have a lot of viable defensive items for a class that's not supposed to have defensive stats.

- Didn't need to hear how bot lane is the most important lane. Everyone already knows it? I never even said that the game is balanced around bot lane, I said adc's were balanced around the ability to be burst (as that was their weakness) which has become *significantly* harder to do. Idk how you misinterpreted that but uh...just another irrelevant point you made I guess :/

- Don't care that the advantage of ranged exists in every ranged champion, we are talking about adc's and I was stating *all* of their advantages (including ones they've always had)...I'm honestly so confused how you've gotten so far off track. What kind of justification is that anyways, "it's ok to add defensive properties to adcs because they've already had X (inserts ranged or any other defensive advantage here) from the get go"

- Cool, so we both agree that lifesteal is quite easy to obtain in large amounts. You just need crit and 1 lifesteal item...pretty easy to get

> You can still burst them.

ok? And juggernauts were still able to die back in the juggernaut meta. The argument is that it's significantly harder to burst adcs now, much harder in previous seasons, not that it was impossible

Your entire comment completely missed the point of the discussion...
